text: 116 D-Show Service Guide Replacing a D-Show FOH Rack DDR-DIMM Figure 1. The following procedure outlines the steps needed to remove and replace the DDR-DIMM on the D-Show FOH Rack as ndicated ini Figure 1. D-Show FOH Rack DDR-DIMM. If you are using a power screwdriver please be sure to use the lowest torque setting to prevent damage to screws or inserts. To remove the D-Show FOH Rack DDR-DIMM: 1 Using a #1 Philips screwdriver, remove the 18 type P screws indicated in Figure 2 that secure the Front Panel to the FOH Rack. Figure 2. Remove 18 screws. The Front Panel should now lift away from the FOH Rack s indicated in Figure 3. 2 a Figure 3. Lift Front Panel away from FOH Rack. Carefully disconnect the 2 fan cables from the IO Card as dicted in Figure 4. Take note of cables and orientation. 3 in Figure 4. Disconnect fan cables. 4 Using a #1 Philips screwdriver, remove the 10 type P screws indicated in Figures 5 and 6 that secure the Top Panel to the FOH Rack. Figure 5. Remove 5 screws from left side. Figure 6. Remove 5 screws from right side. D-Show Service Guide 117 5 The T Rack as indicated in Figure 7. op Panel should now lift away from the FOH Figure 7. Lift Top Panel away. 6 You should now be able to access the DDR-DIMM which is indicated in Figure 8. Figure 8. DDR-DIMM. 7 Carefully open the 2 clips that secure the DDR-DIMM to the motherboard as indicated in Figure 9. Figure 9. Open clips. The DDR-DIMM should now lift away from the motherboard as indicated in Figure 10. 8 Figure 10. Lift DDR-DIMM away. To replace the D-Show FOH Rack DDR-DIMM: 9 Carefully place the DDR-DIMM into position in the motherboard and secure by closing the clips indicated in Figure 9. 10 Carefully place the Top Panel into position in the FOH Rack. 11 Using a #1 Philips screwdriver, insert the 10 type P screws indicated in Figures 5 and 6 that secure the Top Panel to the FOH Rack. 12 Carefully connect the 2 fan cables from the IO Card as indicted in Figure 4. Take note of cables and orientation. 13 Using a #1 Philips screwdriver, insert the 18 type P screws indicated in Figure 2 that secure the Front Panel to the FOH Rack.
